Package com.twilio.raas.sql

Class CalciteRow

java.lang.Object
com.twilio.raas.sql.CalciteRow
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Comparable<CalciteRow>
public final class CalciteRow
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<CalciteRow>
A Plain Java Object that represents a Projected response from Kudu RPCs. It is Comparable to itself and plays a role in preserving the natural sort on scans.

  • Constructor Details

    • CalciteRow

      public CalciteRow​(org.apache.kudu.Schema rowSchema, java.lang.Object[] rowData, java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> primaryKeyColumnsInProjection, java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> descendingSortedFieldIndices)
      Create a Calcite row with provided rowData. Used for Testing.
      Parameters:
      rowSchema - The schema of the query projection
      rowData - Raw data for the row. Needs to conform to rowSchema.
      primaryKeyColumnsInProjection - Ordered list of primary keys within the Projection.
      descendingSortedFieldIndices - Index of the descending sorted fields in the rowSchema projection

    • CalciteRow

      public CalciteRow​(org.apache.kudu.client.RowResult rowFromKudu, java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> primaryKeyColumnsInProjection, java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> descendingSortedFieldIndices)
      Create a Calcite row from an Scanner result.
      Parameters:
      rowFromKudu - Row returned from the Scanner RPC.
      primaryKeyColumnsInProjection - Ordered list of primary keys within the Projection.
      descendingSortedFieldIndices - Index of the descending sorted fields in the rowSchema projection

  • Method Details

    • findPrimaryKeyColumnsInProjection

      public static java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> findPrimaryKeyColumnsInProjection​(org.apache.kudu.Schema projectedSchema, org.apache.kudu.Schema tableSchema)
      Return the Integer indices in the Row Projection that match the primary key columns and in the order they need to match. This lays out how to compare two CalciteRows and determine which one is smaller. As an example, imagine we have a table with primary column in order of A, B and we have a scanner SELECT D, C, E, B, A the projectedSchema will be D, C, E, B, A and the tableSchema will be A, B, C, D, E *this* function will return List(4, 3) -- the position's of A and B within the projection and in the order they need to be sorted by.

    • findColumnsIndicesInProjection

      public static java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> findColumnsIndicesInProjection​(org.apache.kudu.Schema projectedSchema, java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> tableIndices, org.apache.kudu.Schema tableSchema)
      Return the Integer indices of the tableIndices in the Row Projection.
